alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:33PM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Amelia, Prince Edward and Cumberland Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Chesterfield, Amelia and Powhatan Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River above Farmville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:20 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:20 PM EST Wednesday was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 09/19/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EST.
